channel.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
channel.description: Basically what the title says. Right now, many players ignore the social aspect of the game entirely, relying primarily or exclusively on mechanical tools to deduce. While this is a viable strategy, the use of social deduction in ToL, a social deduction game, can improve one's play and make the game more interesting. How can we encourage people to make use of social tools, rather than purely mechanical ones, in solving the game?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
Yep

Read full topic

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
yeah but my point was invests are on a scale from “x is prolly scum” to “x may or may not be sus” (flirt) and its not too many invests that are a problem its if they can cross verify each other too reliably and without the accused having a good defense

item.description:
Yes, but they are most likely scum because tge other two are very less probable.

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
“You will investigate X tonight.”
“X is a member of the Unseen!”

The wording is just for immersion, the actual info you get is “X is Unseen or X is Framed or you were Mindwarped”

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Invest results aren’t explicit like “X is scum” though, they are on a spectrum from stuff like flirt to stuff like investigate

the only exception I can think of is surveille where the result isn’t “Assassin”

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
If someone claims that X is scum, you have a thunderdome where it’s most probable of one of them being scum.

item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I don’t see any need to reduce invests, it’s not like people have anything to go on but your word. There’s no “mechanical” proof you are telling the truth, invests are easiest to fake. Again you don’t want to reduce invests to the point where every game is D2 VFR because nobody has info

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
ToL needs less invests, because it needs less information. Less mechanical info is better for Socialness

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I think ToL is at a good spot with the number of investigatives, you want D2 to begin with leads and not VFR.

What I think could improve is giving scum better defenses, especially NK getting outed by maid, and make “they’re scorned” a more viable defense since disguises are rare and the scorned is like “gg im scorned that was a disguise” as soon as they get their second mark which kind of ruins the whole thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
To promote social deduction, make investigatives less common. Reduce feedback. Have the game where by the time you can confirm everyone, it’s too late.

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
unseen converts more closely matching makes no difference, you get demoted to assassin immediately in practice and cult has enough uses to mimick their starting class until they die

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I don’t think it’s as simple as “Cult are better for social deduction” or “Unseen are better…”

They have different strengths and weaknesses in that sense, so while a direct comparison is technically possible there is a lot to go over in order to reach a conclusion.

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
Yes, but the cult aren’t as harshly punished for being mechanically harmed

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
On the other hand, the more closely-matching Unseen converts in theory force you to rely on noticing behavioral shifts more than the fact that someone can no longer perfectly emulate their claim

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Audreyaloy:

We need to find a way, to prevent players from simply filling the sheet and processus of elimination. so they can focus more on the comportement of players, instead of their claims.

Easiest way to do that is simply have confirming classes be hard enough that by the time you’ve confirmed a critical mass of players you’ve already lost.

Conversion helps with this quite a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
anon97870008:

Read the stuff posted in #dev-blog (on the discord)
To understand 1. why it was necessary and 2. what exactly had to be done

I’m not questioning the why

Just understandably doubtful that we’ll ever hit more than a fraction of the speed at which updates used to release.

I don’t think hoping we continue to make that fraction larger from here on out is either unreasonable or negative, so I would hope there is no need to try and correct it.

Read full topic
item.source: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?

item.title: Discussion: How Can We Promote The Use Of Social Deduction?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
Read the stuff posted in #dev-blog (on the discord)
To understand 1. why it was necessary and 2. what exactly had to be done
We also did had some patches last year which included some meta changes, qol or stability and security patches. While nothing of that is so appealing to players like a fullfledged balance patch, its improving the gameplay experience a lot.
